meanings.definition: To bake (something) partially before finishing it.
meanings.sent1: I always prebake the pie crust before adding the filling.
meanings.sent2: She prebaked the cookies for a few minutes before putting them back in the oven.
meanings.sent3: The chef prebaked the bread, but then forgot to finish baking it!
meanings.sent4: The idea of prebaking the cake layers helped save time during the busy party preparation.
meanings.sent5: Prebaking the pizza crust made it perfectly crispy and delicious.

meanings.definition: The act of partially baking something before finishing it.
meanings.sent1: Prebaking is a common technique used in baking to ensure even cooking.
meanings.sent2: The prebaking of the pastry gave it a nice golden color.
meanings.sent3: The prebaking of the muffins made them look like mini suns in the oven!
meanings.sent4: Her prebaking skills were praised by the baking competition judges.
meanings.sent5: The prebaking of the bread dough filled the kitchen with a warm, inviting aroma.
